page.title: 01Llanberis & Dinorwig
page.content: This area covers Llyn Padarn which runs from south east to north west. To the north of the lake are the lower slopes of Elidir Fawr on which lie the scattered cottages of Dinorwig between ill kept fields close to the slate tips of the old quarry. Beneath this quarry now lies a huge pump storage power station. The remnants of the Snowdonia forest have now been preserved as a country park alongside the lake. This now attracts 100,000 visitors a year. To the south west of the lake is Llanberis village with a population of 2000 largely dependant on tourism. It has 4 small light industrial units which provide some employment; but the impression of the village is one of hardship and impoverishment.
